pull.title: kernel: Remove key module from kernel library
pull.body:
The key module's functionality is not used by the kernel library, but currently kernel users are still required to initialize the key module's `secp256k1_context_sign` global as part of the `kernel::Context` through `ECC_Start`. So move the `ECC_Start` call to the `NodeContext` ctor instead to completely remove the key module from the kernel library.

The gui tests currently keep multiple `NodeContext` objects in memory, so relax the `secp256k1_context_sign` check in `ECC_Start` to instead return early if it has already been initialized.

---

This PR is part of the [libbitcoinkernel project](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/27587). It removes a module from the kernel library.

issue.title: kernel: Run sanity checks on context construction
issue.body: Moving the kernel sanity check code to kernel context instantiation time ensures that it is impossible to create an invalid kernel context. This is based on a suggestion made in a [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25065#discussion_r882182549) by @theuni in the [original pull request](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25065) first introducing the `kernel::Context`.

events.body:
> The gui tests currently keep multiple `NodeContext` objects in memory, so relax the `secp256k1_context_sign` check in `ECC_Start` to instead return early if it has already been initialized.

An alternative would be to call `ECC_Stop` in the gui tests instead of modifying key code?

verification.payload:
tree d29290d030808cc7f1fd1994e0a98e14c1d2fb80
parent 05c4c5a4347018d6d0e81b8f12cf5bdcaa8b4a89
author TheCharlatan <seb.kung@gmail.com> 1705319731 +0100
committer TheCharlatan <seb.kung@gmail.com> 1705419528 +0100

kernel: Remove key module from kernel library

The key module's functionality is not used by the kernel library, but
currently kernel users are still required to initialize the key module's
`secp256k1_context_sign` global as part of the `kernel::Context` through
`ECC_Start`. So move the `ECC_Start` call to the `NodeContext` ctor
instead to completely remove the key module from the kernel library.

The gui tests currently keep multiple `NodeContext` objects in memory,
so call `ECC_Stop` before instantiating a new `NodeContext`.

kernel: Remove key module from kernel library

The key module's functionality is not used by the kernel library, but
currently kernel users are still required to initialize the key module's
`secp256k1_context_sign` global as part of the `kernel::Context` through
`ECC_Start`. So move the `ECC_Start` call to the `NodeContext` ctor
instead to completely remove the key module from the kernel library.

The gui tests currently keep multiple `NodeContext` objects in memory,
so call `ECC_Stop` before instantiating a new `NodeContext`.

* Implemented @maflcko's [suggestion](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29252#issuecomment-1893335214), calling `ECC_Stop` instead of relaxing the `ECC_Start` check.

comments.body: Removing this will lead to compile errors when a `unique_ptr` member is added with a fwd decl, no?
need to remove include as well, no?
Seems better to leave as-is, or remove the comment, if it is no longer accurate?
Will leave as is then. Seems likely that something will end up here.

clang-tidy doesn't like it being left there. Its suggestion of defaulting it in the header seems counter to what we want to achieve here.
```
/home/drgrid/bitcoin/src/./kernel/context.h:22:5: error: class 'Context' can be made trivially destructible by defaulting the destructor on its first declaration [performance-trivially-destructible,-warnings-as-errors]
    ~Context();
    ^
               = default
kernel/context.cpp:23:10: note: destructor definition is here
Context::~Context() = default;
         ^
```
